title: Terrorist told victim's wife: 'Won't kill you, go tell Modi'
content: In a shocking incident, 28 tourists were killed in a terrorist attack near Pahalgam, J&K, marking the deadliest such event since 2019. The Resistance Front, linked to LeT, claimed responsibility. The attack, coinciding with significant international visits and heightened tensions with Pakistan, evoked memories of past massacres.

title: J&K attack: On holiday, IB officer posted in Hyd shot in front of wife, kids
content: An Intelligence Bureau officer from Hyderabad died in the Pahalgam terror attack. He was on vacation with his family. Terrorists killed at least 28 tourists in Jammu and Kashmir. The Resistance Front claimed responsibility. The attack occurred during US Vice President's visit to India. It also coincided with Prime Minister Modi's trip to Saudi Arabia.

title: BLUNDER! Did Ramiz Raja accidentally endorse IPL during PSL?
content: During a post-match presentation at the PSL, commentator Ramiz Raja mistakenly referred to the tournament as the "HBL IPL," a slip-up that quickly went viral.

title: Mark Zuckerberg, JP Morgan CEO & others sold billions in stock before Trump Tariffs
content: Before President Trump's tariff announcement triggered a market crash, Meta's Mark Zuckerberg, JP Morgan Chase's Jamie Dimon, and Oracle's Safra Catz sold significant amounts of stock. These sales, totaling billions, occurred just before the market downturn, raising questions about potential insider knowledge. While the market plummeted, some billionaires saw it as a buying opportunity.

title: 'Victims deserve justice': Rahul Gandhi speaks with Shah, J&K CM after Pahalgam attack
content: Following the terror attack in Pahalgam, which resulted in the deaths of at least 28 tourists, the Leader of Opposition spoke with Home Minister Amit Shah to assess the situation. He also contacted Chief Minister Omar Abdullah and J&K PCC President Tariq Karra, advocating for justice and support for the victims' families.

title: 'Will spend less time at DOGE': Musk to focus on Tesla as its profits plunge 71%
content: Elon Musk announced his reduced involvement with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) starting in May, coinciding with Tesla's 71% profit drop and a 9% revenue decrease. Analysts attribute Tesla's sales decline partly to Musk's controversial DOGE role, sparking protests and vandalism.

title: Pakistan Army chief's dog whistle being seen as trigger for bloodbath
content: Following General Asim Munir's provocative statements regarding Kashmir, intelligence sources suggest a potential link to the recent Lashkar-e-Taiba attack in Pahalgam, coinciding with US VP's visit. The Resistance Front (TRF), an LeT proxy, claimed responsibility, with LeT commander Saifullah Kasuri suspected of plotting the attack. Intelligence agencies believe around six terrorists, supported by local elements, executed the strike after reconnaissance.

title: Zoho founder replies to Uday Kotak's comment as gold hits Rs 1 Lakh
content: Uday Kotak's recent statement praising Indian housewives as astute fund managers due to their traditional investment in gold has sparked widespread discussion. Sridhar Vembu supported this view, emphasizing gold's role in India's stability and civilizational continuity. Amidst soaring gold prices and global economic uncertainty, the debate on gold's accessibility for ordinary citizens has resurfaced.

title: KL Rahul haunts old team as DC crush Rishabh Pant's LSG
content: Delhi Capitals secured a dominant eight-wicket victory against Lucknow Super Giants, propelled by KL Rahul's unbeaten 57 and Abishek Porel's explosive 51. Rahul reached a milestone, becoming the fastest Indian to 5000 IPL runs. Mukesh Kumar's impressive 4/34 restricted LSG to 159/6, setting the stage for DC's comfortable chase and solidifying their second position on the points table.

title: US state department to undergo 'massive overhaul': Key details of Trump's plan
content: The Trump administration, under Secretary of State Marco Rubio, is initiating a significant overhaul of the State Department, aiming to streamline operations and prioritize "America First." The reorganization involves consolidating bureaus, reducing domestic staff by 15%, and establishing a new office to oversee foreign assistance and humanitarian affairs.

title: Microsoft’s chief HR to managers: This isn't just about Microsoft's success...
content: Microsoft is implementing stricter performance management policies, including a two-year rehire ban for underperformers and restrictions on internal transfers. These changes aim to accelerate high performance and swiftly address low performance, aligning with industry trends toward performance-based evaluations. The company is also introducing AI-supported tools to aid managers in performance conversations.

title: ‘Jaat’ Box Office collection day 13: Film mints Rs 2 crore on second Tuesday
content: Despite facing controversy and competition from 'Kesari Chapter 2', Sunny Deol and Randeep Hooda's 'Jaat' has maintained a steady box office performance, earning Rs. 78.25 crore in India after 13 days. The film experienced a slight dip in morning shows but saw improvements in the evening, indicating continued audience interest.

title: People wail for help as loved ones lie in pools of blood: Pahalgam attack
content: Pahalgam in South Kashmir experienced a terror attack. Terrorists attacked a tourist spot in Baisaran Valley. The attack resulted in at least 20 injuries. Security forces and locals assisted in rescue operations. Authorities are investigating the incident. Top officials condemned the attack, and assured that the perpetrators will face consequences.

title: New Jersey wildfire burns 1,200 acres, prompts evacuations
content: A rapidly spreading wildfire in Barnegat Township, New Jersey, has forced mandatory evacuations as it consumes 1,200 acres. The New Jersey Forest Fire Service reports the fire is uncontained, threatening sixteen structures. The Garden State Parkway is closed near Exit 69, and firefighting crews are battling the blaze with aerial support. The cause is currently under investigation.

title: SC begins drive to ensure unclaimed payouts reach road accident victims
content: The Supreme Court has expressed concern over hundreds of crores of rupees lying unclaimed in Motor Accident Claims Tribunals and labour courts due to missing claimant information. To address this, the court directed High Courts to initiate extensive outreach programs to ensure that road accident victims and workers receive their entitled compensation.

title: USFDA to 'phase out' eight approved synthetic food dyes by 2027
content: The US government plans to ban synthetic food dyes by 2026, citing health concerns like ADHD and cancer, especially in children. FDA Commissioner Marty Makary highlighted studies linking these dyes to various health issues. The ban, building on a previous prohibition of Red Dye 3, aims to overhaul the food system under the 'Make America Healthy Again' agenda.

title: Pahalgam attack: An abomination, says Omar; LG vows killers won’t go unpunished
content: Following a devastating terrorist attack on tourists in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir, widespread condemnation has erupted from political leaders and organizations. Chief Minister Omar Abdullah and Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha vowed a strong response, with Sinha promising severe consequences for the perpetrators.

title: 'Will not live in fear': Pennsylvania governor reopens home days after attack
content: Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro reopened the governor's residence for an Easter egg hunt shortly after an alleged arson attack. Cody Balmer, the suspect, is accused of setting fire to the residence, causing millions in damages. Despite the incident, Shapiro affirmed his resilience and commitment to not living in fear, proceeding with the public event while security enhancements are being evaluated.

title: IAF man booked for attempt to murder in Bengaluru road rage case
content: Bengaluru police have filed an FIR against IAF Wing Commander Shiladitya Bose for attempted murder following a road-rage incident that escalated into a language controversy. CM Siddaramaiah condemned Bose's remarks about Karnataka and Kannadigas, while the biker involved, Vikas Kumar, was initially arrested but later released on bail, claiming false accusations and filing a counter-complaint against Bose.

title: JD Vance pushes F-35s 'to help IAF secure India's airspace'
content: Vice-President J D Vance, during his India visit, lauded PM Modi's leadership and advocated for a stronger US-India partnership across various sectors like defense, energy, and technology. He emphasized rebalancing global trade for mutual benefit and urged India to consider acquiring F-35 fighter jets to enhance its air security.

title: Trump dials PM Modi, assures 'full support to India in fight against terror'
content: Following the deadly terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam that claimed the lives of at least 26 people, mostly tourists, US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin strongly condemned the violence and assured India of their support in fighting terrorism.

title: KL Rahul's cryptic post after demolishing former team LSG
content: KL Rahul's unbeaten half-century powered Delhi Capitals to an eight-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants. Rahul, playing against his former team, reached the 5,000-run milestone in the IPL during his innings. Abishek Porel's aggressive knock of 51 also contributed significantly to Delhi's successful chase of 160, while Mukesh Kumar's four-wicket haul restricted Lucknow to a manageable total.

title: From Amarnath to Pahalgam: Major civilian terror strikes in J&K since 2000
content: On April 22, a terrorist attack in Anantnag district's Pahalgam area killed 26 people, including tourists and security personnel. The assault, which occurred near the Baisaran Valley, claimed the life of an Indian Navy officer and two foreign nationals. This incident is the latest in a series of attacks targeting civilians and security forces in Kashmir since 2000.

title: Waqf law issue: AIMPLB accuses NDA constituents of ‘stabbing Muslims in the back’
content: The All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) has strongly criticized NDA allies for supporting the Waqf Amendment Act, accusing them of betraying the Muslim community. At a 'Save Waqf' conference in Delhi, AIMPLB demanded the law's withdrawal, warning of widespread opposition.

title: KL Rahul gets his redemption in Lucknow with massive IPL milestone
content: KL Rahul achieved a significant milestone, reaching 5000 IPL runs in a record 130 innings, as Delhi Capitals secured a dominant 8-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants. Rahul's unbeaten 57, along with Abishek Porel's fifty, guided DC to chase down the target of 160 with ease. Mukesh Kumar's impressive 4/33 helped restrict LSG to a below-par total.

title: In a first, Mehbooba, Mirwaiz call for J&K shutdown today
content: Following the terrorist attack on tourists in Pahalgam, PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti and Hurriyat leader Mirwaiz Umar Farooq have jointly called for a "Kashmir bandh" on Wednesday. Mehbooba urged Kashmiris to unite in solidarity, echoing the Jammu Chamber and Bar Association's shutdown call, to condemn the cowardly act of terror.

title: SC’s TN ruling doesn’t entirely cover Kerala government dispute: Centre
content: The Centre argued before the Supreme Court that its ruling in the Tamil Nadu governor's case doesn't fully resolve the legal dispute between Kerala and its governor. Kerala's counsel claimed the verdict addresses the issue of time limits for presidential reference. The Centre's representatives, however, asserted that certain aspects remain unaddressed and require further examination by the court.

title: 'Numb disbelief': Cricketers condemn Pahalgam terror attack
content: Following the deadly terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Kashmir, which claimed 26 lives, Indian cricketers - past and present - Shubman Gill, Gautam Gambhir, Parthiv Patel, and Aakash Chopra condemned the violence. Gambhir asserted that those responsible would face consequences. Union Home Minister Amit Shah, along with Lt Governor Manoj Sinha, visited Srinagar to assess the situation and meet with officials and victims.

title: What is The Resistance Front? TRF claims responsibility for J&K attack
content: The Resistance Front (TRF), a proxy for Lashkar-e-Taiba, claimed responsibility for the Pahalgam attack that killed 26 tourists. This banned group recruits youth online for terrorist activities and is supported by Pakistani intelligence. Following the deadly attack, Union Home Minister Amit Shah arrived in Srinagar to assess the security situation and will chair a high-level meeting with security officials.

title: Watch: KL Rahul hurries away as Sanjiv Goenka looks for handshake
content: KL Rahul marked his return to Ekana Cricket Stadium with an unbeaten half-century, guiding Delhi Capitals to a dominant 8-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants. His composed innings, along with Abishek Porel's fifty, ensured a comfortable chase of 160. Mukesh Kumar's four-wicket haul earlier restricted Lucknow to a manageable total, setting the stage for Delhi's triumph.

title: Forced to climb down 30-foot well, women in this Nashik Village risk lives
content: Residents of Borichibari village in Nashik face a severe water crisis, forcing women to risk climbing down a well for water. Despite claims of water supply by the gram panchayat, villagers report otherwise. A viral video shows a woman descending into a well, prompting an official inspection.

title: 'I regret playing cricket': Former India captain drops bombshell
content: Mohammad Azharuddin has voiced his profound disappointment after the HCA Ombudsman ordered the removal of his name from the North Stand at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium. He expressed feeling heartbroken and described the situation as a complete disgrace to the sport, further alleging corruption within the HCA led to him being barred from contesting elections.

title: Royals match-fixing allegation: Battle for IPL tickets takes centre-stage
content: Rajasthan Royals have strongly refuted match-fixing allegations made by Rajasthan Cricket Association ad-hoc committee convener Jaydeep Bihani, labelling them as baseless and defamatory. The franchise asserts that Bihani's claims undermine the team, the BCCI, and the integrity of cricket. A BCCI official dismissed the allegations, suggesting they stem from upcoming RCA elections.

title: UPSC Civil Services 2024: Pune's Archit Dongre achieves AIR 3
content: Archit Parag Dongre from Pune has achieved All India Rank 3 in the UPSC Civil Services Examination 2024, making him Maharashtra's top performer. The UPSC announced the final results on April 22, 2025, recommending 1,009 candidates for various services. Dongre, an engineering graduate from VIT, previously secured AIR 153 in 2023.

title: Pope Francis death: The curious connection between World Wars and papal deaths
content: But here’s the thing: timing is not causality. The idea that papal deaths somehow signal or foreshadow world wars is compelling as a narrative—especially in a social media age where historical trivia morphs easily into eschatological prophecy. But it falls into a classic logical trap: post hoc ergo propter hoc—after this, therefore because of this.

title: 'KL Rahul to replace Rishabh Pant in 2026 T20 World Cup'
content: Astrologer Greenstone Lobo predicts changes for India's 2026 T20 World Cup team. KL Rahul may replace Rishabh Pant. Abhishek Sharma and Shubman Gill could step in for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. Shreyas Iyer might replace Shivam Dube. Vipraj Nigam is a long-term prospect for Ravindra Jadeja. Mayank Yadav could partner with Arshdeep Singh.

title: Celtics' Pritchard honored with Sixth Man award
content: Payton Pritchard, who went from the fringes of the Boston rotation to a constant source of energy and production off the bench, was named the NBA's Sixth Man of the Year.

title: Jones: Cowboys working on 'substantive trades'
content: Owner and general manager Jerry Jones said Tuesday the Cowboys are working on "pretty substantive trades" ahead of the NFL draft.

title: Magic's physicality irks Horford; Tatum doubtful
content: Celtics veteran Al Horford reiterated his belief that the Magic stepped over the line with their physicality on Jayson Tatum in Boston's Game 1 win Sunday.

title: Mike Patrick, longtime ESPN broadcaster, dies
content: Mike Patrick, who spent 36 years as a play-by-play commentator for ESPN and was the network's first NFL voice for "Sunday Night Football," has died at age 80.

title: Sources: Browns, Giants field trade calls for picks
content: The Browns and Giants are fielding trade inquiries for their early picks in the NFL draft, sources told ESPN.

title: OSU's Bjork tells CFP: Calendar change needed
content: Ohio State athletic director Ross Bjork told leaders of the College Football Playoff on Tuesday that the sport's calendar needs to change, and it's a critical component as they consider the playoff's future format.

title: Ex-NFL kicker Feely to run for Congress in Ariz.
content: Former NFL kicker Jay Feely is leaving the broadcast booth after a decade and entering the political arena, telling ESPN's Josh Weinfuss on Tuesday that he will run for the U.S. House of Representatives in Arizona's 5th Congressional District.

title: Colón fired as CEO of U.S. Center for SafeSport
content: The U.S. Center for SafeSport fired CEO Ju'Riese Colón on Tuesday in the latest and most visceral sign of a crisis that began after revelations the center had hired an investigator who would later be charged with rape.

title: Our annual NFL Nation mock draft: All 32 team reporters make their picks for Round 1
content: The Titans filled their biggest need at quarterback with the No. 1 pick, but which team was next to take a QB?

title: One ring away: The players who could cement their legacies with a title this season
content: Great regular seasons don't cement NBA legacies. Great playoff runs do. These six stars -- featuring one MVP and a likely one -- need deep playoff runs to secure their places in the game.

title: NBA Rank, playoffs edition: The 50 most impactful players for 2025
content: From MVP hopefuls to postseason heroes, we're counting down the top 50 players who will decide the 2025 playoffs.

title: 'Completely separate and at odds': The divisions and chaos that led to the end of the Luka Doncic era in Dallas
content: Doncic's time in Dallas ended with a shocking trade on Feb. 2, but the beginning of the end dates to the summer of 2023.

title: 'Once-in-a-lifetime experience:' How the NFL's smallest market is coming up big to host the draft
content: The Lambeau countdown clock to the draft is running out of days, and the NFL's smallest town is ready.

title: Man City's Champions League push shows fight, even if spark is missing
content: Even if it has not been Manchester City's best season, their last-minute win against Aston Villa can provide an extra boost to qualify for the Champions League.

title: UEFA give Man City $6m for most int'l call-ups
content: Manchester City were allocated around €5.17 million ($5.94m), the most of any UEFA club, as part of the European football governing body's Club Benefits Programme to encourage national team participation by players.

title: Source: Man Utd eye Wolves, Brazil star Cunha
content: Manchester United are exploring the possibility of triggering the release clause in Matheus Cunha's contract at Wolves, a source has told ESPN.

title: Ex-KC GK Schult: Euro teams don't want moms
content: As an Olympic gold medalist and Champions League winner, Almuth Schult was one of the top goalkeepers in women's soccer. She believes her career ended early because European clubs were reluctant to sign a player with children.

title: Arteta reluctant to rest key players in PL
content: Mikel Arteta has suggested he won't be resting Bukayo Saka for their upcoming Premier League games as they prepare for their Champions League showdown against Paris Saint-Germain.

title: TST: Solo, Agüero learn matchups for $1M tourney
content: The seven-on-seven soccer teams led by Carli Lloyd, Hope Solo, Ali Krieger, Luis Nani, Miguel Layún, Sergio Agüero and other stars learned their fate for The Soccer Tournament from June 4-9 in Cary, North Carolina.

title: USMNT defender Jones joins Quakes from Crew
content: The San Jose Earthquakes signed United States defender DeJuan Jones from the Columbus Crew on Tuesday.

title: Ancelotti on Madrid future: Anything is possible
content: Carlo Ancelotti insisted that "anything is possible" regarding his future as Real Madrid coach on Tuesday, as the team look to beat Barcelona to a LaLiga and Copa del Rey double.

title: Wrexham edge closer to promotion with key win
content: Wrexham climbed back into the automatic promotion spots in League 1 with a crucial 2-1 win over Blackpool on Monday.

title: Our Draft Day Predictor settles 10 debates: What the numbers say about QB picks, Round 1 surprises
content: Which QBs will still be available on Day 2? Could Ashton Jeanty slide to the Bears? And where might the top pass catchers land?

title: SGA or Jokic? Castle or Risacher? Our experts pick every NBA award
content: Finalists have been unveiled for seven major individual awards, including MVP. Which superstars did our experts' pick?

title: 'Hello, old friend': Randy Orton delivers surprise RKO on John Cena at Raw
content: A day after winning his record 17th WWE title, John Cena ran into a familiar foe on Monday Night Raw.

title: Bullpen stock watch: Devin Williams deserves a little faith
content: Everything fantasy baseball managers need to know about which closers should be added, dropped, and more.

title: South Carolina up, UCLA down: How the transfer portal impacts the women's Way-Too-Early Top 25﻿
content: Big transfers have put South Carolina at No. 1 and propelled the likes of LSU, Oklahoma and Tennessee higher.

title: Rankings, projections, strategy and cheat sheets
content: Rankings, projections, player profiles, draft strategies -- we've got everything you need to dominate your fantasy women's basketball draft from every angle.

title: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025 WNBA season
content: Which players will exceed fantasy expectations? Who will disappoint? And who is ready to reach an elite level?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye River Plate star Mastantuono
content: Manchester United are considering a move for emerging River Plate star Franco Mastantuono. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Chris Eubank Jr. vs Conor Benn: How to watch, ring walk time, undercard
content: Chris Eubank Jr. and Conor Benn will face each other in London on Saturday. Here is everything you need to know ahead of the highly anticipated bout.

title: 'I found your dad': The mystery of a missing climber
content: Bill Stampfl vanished climbing Peru's highest mountain 22 years ago. This is the story of the hiker who found him and brought closure to Stampfl's family.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack Updates: PM Modi Cuts Short Saudi Visit, Lands In Delhi
content: Kashmir terror attack live updates: At least 26 civilians, mostly tourists, were killed in a terror attack in Pahalgam in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag district on Tuesday, sources said, in what is the deadliest attack in the Valley since 2019.

title: Navy Officer, Married Just 5 Days Ago, Killed In Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: Lieutenant Vinay Narwal, a 26-year-old Indian Navy officer from Karnal, Haryana, was tragically killed in a terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir. Narwal had recently married and was on leave, enjoying a short vacation in Kashmir.

title: Elon Musk Says He Will Reduce Work For Trump As Tesla Profits Drop 71%
content: Elon Musk plans to "significantly" reduce his work for Donald Trump's administration in May to focus on Tesla, the billionaire CEO said Tuesday.

title: Trump Says He Has "No Intention" Of Firing Fed Chief
content: US President Donald Trump said Tuesday he had no plans to fire the Federal Reserve chief, in apparently conciliatory remarks after berating him and triggering market turmoil.

title: Earthquake Of Magnitude 4.3 Hits Gujarat's Kachchh
content: An earthquake of magnitude 4.3 on the Richter scale hit Gujarat's Kachchh district on Tuesday night, according to the National Centre for Seismology (NCS).

title: PM Modi Cuts Short Saudi Trip After J&K Attack, Leaves For India
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will cut short his Saudi Arabia trip and leave for India tonight, say government sources, after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam claimed 26 lives.

title: Trump Dials PM Modi After Kashmir Attack, Extends "Full Support" To India
content: US President Donald Trump strongly condemned the terror attack in Kashmir's Pahalgam in a phone call with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and expressed full support to India to bring to justice the perpetrators of this heinous attack.

title: PM Modi Meets "Brother" Mohammed Bin Salman In Saudi, Key Agreements Signed
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman in Jeddah on Tuesday, where the two leaders held wide-ranging bilateral talks. Four key agreements were signed following the hours-long meeting between the two leaders.

title: "A Man Came And Shot My Husband": Tourists' Horror In Pahalgam
content: "Please save my husband," a woman's bone-chilling wails echoed through the picturesque valley of Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam after terrorists opened fire at tourists today.

title: 18-Year-Old UP Student Allegedly Shot Dead In School: Cops
content: An 18-year-old student died during treatment after allegedly being shot in a private school located here in Khushalnagar, a police official said.

title: Navy Officer Among 26 Killed In Terror Attack In J&K's Pahalgam: Sources
content: Twenty-six people were killed and several others were injured as terrorists opened fire on tourists in Pahalgam today, in the worst terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir in recent times.

title: Ambuja Cement Acquires 37.8% Promoters' Stake In Orient Cement
content: Adani Group-owned Ambuja Cements has completed the acquisition of 37.8 per cent promoters' stake of CK Birla group firm Orient Cement Ltd (OCL) and has become a promoter.

title: Real Or Photoshopped? Joe Biden's Family Photo Raises Eyebrows Online
content: As soon as the photo went online, users were quick to point out several inconsistencies, raising doubts about its authenticity.

title: The Billion Dollar Diamond Treasure Inside A Volcano In Africa
content: The Jwaneng Diamond Mine, located in Botswana, is the richest diamond mine globally, with an estimated value of 1 billion euros.

title: Intelligence Bureau Officer Shot In Front Of Wife, Children In J&K Attack
content: An Intelligence Bureau (IB) officer from Hyderabad is among the tourists killed in the terror attack in Kashmir on Tuesday.

title: Maharashtra Anthem To Be Sung In All Schools, Says Education Minister
content: State song 'Jai Jai Maharashtra Majha' should be sung in all schools in the state after the national anthem, School Education Minister Dada Bhuse said on Tuesday.

title: Ready To Hold Talks With Russia Once Ceasefire Deal In Place: Zelensky
content: President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Tuesday that Ukraine would be ready to hold talks with Russia in any format once a ceasefire is in place and the fighting between Kyiv and Moscow's forces has stopped.

title: Australian Twins Speak In Unison While Recalling Armed Carjacking, Go Viral
content: Two identical twin sisters from Queensland are going viral after ruminating about their frightening encounter with an alleged gunman, but it's not the story that's drawing attention.

title: Why Pope Francis Named Himself After Italian Saint St Francis of Assisi
content: When Jorge Mario Bergoglio became pope in 2013, he chose a name no pontiff had ever taken: Francis. It was inspired by St Francis of Assisi - the saint of the poor, the humble and the earth.

title: Odisha Man, On Trip With Wife And Son, Killed As He Got Off Pahalgam Ropeway
content: A tourist from Odisha was killed in the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam this afternoon.

title: EC rejects Rahul's claims of voting spike in Maharashtra
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‘prime’ political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India’s neighbourhood. title: Ranking the top 10 defensive backs in college football
content: Ohio State's Caleb Downs is the best defensive back in college football in 2025 . he was targeted 14 times last season and allowed 2.1 yards per attempt . our college football reporters were asked to select the top 10 defensive backs .

title: Haliburton and Pacers take 2-0 lead over Bucks
content: Detroit Pistons and Cade Cunningham are back in their series against the no. 3 seed new york Knicks . the playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals. here's what matters most.

title: Prospect X: Inside the draft process for this mystery player
content: the draft begins on friday at 8 PM on ESPN, ABC, ESPN Deportes and the NFL Network . Prospect X jogs to the line of scrimmage and quickly takes up a ready stance . "Take your time," the coach says, and his voice echos through the empty stadium .

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Hurricanes new favorites following Avalanche Game 2 loss
content: the 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs have begun with 16 teams looking to be the last one standing after four rounds of playoff hockey . the Toronto Maple Leafs will look to snap the longest championship drought in NHL history . they will have to contend with their cross-state rivals, the Ottawa Senators .

title: NBA playoff odds; Thunder, Celtics heavily favored to play for NBA championship
content: the top-seeded Oklahoma City Thunder entered the playoffs as favorites to win the NBA championship . the Los Angeles Lakers , Golden State Warriors , LA Clippers , Denver Nuggets and Minnesota Timberwolves all have better odds than the second-seed Houston Rockets . despite their game 1 win, the Timberwolves are still well behind the lakers in the odds .

title: Follow live: Lakers look to bounce back in Game 2 vs. Timberwolves

title: Tightest title races: Serie A playoff? 6 potential champions?
content: a lot of titles are already a foregone conclusion in most countries in Europe . there are also a few leagues across Europe, and even elsewhere in England . the most high-profile title race that is reaching boiling point is Italy's Serie A .

title: College baseball Week 10: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: we're getting down to crunch time for some teams to prove themselves . the biggest riser was Vanderbilt, which jumped up 10 spots after sweeping Georgia . Ole Miss dropped 12 spots to no. 23 in the ranking this week after losing a road series to south Carolina .

title: Nari ‘Shakti’: UPSC exam topper, No. 2 & 4 women; Delhi man 5th
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with the Times of India, new Delhi . she has been writing on security matters since 1996 . her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife .

title: EV targets not met, claims plea; SC seeks Centre's report
content: 10 morning habits parents should role model to instill discipline in kids ​Nyrraa Banerji with the glow of timeless grace​ 8 best zoos in the US – not just for the usual animals 10 BTS qoutes which will make your day Pinterest-worthy sarees that are a must-have in your wardrobe Baby names inspired by saints and sages of India Summer special: This viral Mango Sago Pudding is worth trying! 10 Shakespeare quotes that help deal with the problems of modern life ​Not just giraffes, these animals and birds too have long, beautiful necks

title: Arrest of Anjaneyulu is ‘shameful distraction politics’, says Roja
content: Naidu’s policies have harmed farmers, fuelled land, liquor, and mining scams, alleges the YSRCP leader

title: India’s political infodemic: notes from five State elections
content: Targeted campaigns and pointed propaganda have made their way directly to private messages, shaping public opinion and discourse in unexpected ways, and thereby offering a modern means to electoral victory

title: Caste census: Dominant castes’ real fear is over political power dynamics at the grassroots
content: The numbers that have now been published in the survey are likely to allow the other backward classes to challenge the traditional dominance of some communities

title: Akhilesh Yadav reiterates caste-based posting allegations, hits out at DGP
content: There is discrimination in postings in police stations under the BJP government, alleges Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav

title: Yeshasvini health scheme: Committee recommends rate revision of up to 50% for some procedures
content: ‘The existing rates fixed in 2017-2018 were too low for several procedures, and many private hospitals were hesitant to get empanelled’

title: Grounds of arrest to accused: We want to strike balance, says Supreme Court
content: The top court seeks balance between State power and accused rights, addresses necessity of furnishing grounds of arrest

title: Our college softball rankings after Week 11: Top 25 poll, plus what to watch
content: the Lady Vols are coming off a series sweep over Auburn and ride into week 12 on a five-game win streak . Oregon has jumped one spot to no. 5 after taking two games against UCLA . this week's top 25 ranking includes who and what to watch .

title: Terrorists cursed Modi, asked my father to recite Islamic verse before shooting him: Daughter
content: “Then the terrorists blamed them for supporting Prime Minister Narendra Modi, after which they made some statements to deny that Kashmiri militants kill innocent people, women and children”

title: Waqf present in every Muslim country, says Owaisi
content: The president of AIMIM party Asaduddin Owaisi also accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of hypocrisy, saying that Mr. Modi “hates Muslims” but “will be friends” with Saudi Crown-Prince.

title: Naruvi Hospital’s webinar on arthritis on April 27
content: The ninth of the 15-part ‘Healthy India, Happy India’ webinar series will focus on rheumatoid arthritis

title: History in frames: marking moments in print with The Hindu’s front pages
content: “Relive the News, Relive the Day”, an initiative launched by The Hindu, allows readers to request a framed reprint of the newspaper’s front page from any date, going back as far as 1880.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Raipur businessman killed on wedding anniversary, say neighbours
content: The Mirania family, assuming that the situation had improved in Jammu and Kashmir had decided to organise a religious function there

title: Trump, Putin, Meloni and other world leaders condemn Pahalgam terror attack
content: The United States stands strong with India against terrorism, says Trump; Putin says the "brutal crime" has no justification whatsoever and its perpetrators will face a deserved punishment

title: Saha addresses flood fears over Bangladesh border embankment
content: Manik Saha says his government has taken necessary measures in response to the construction of a massive embankment by the Bangladesh government along the border in South Tripura district

title: Saudi Arabia is a force of positivity and stability: PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister receives warm welcome in the historic city of Jeddah; he describes the energy-rich kingdom as ‘one of India’s most valued partners, a trusted friend and a strategic ally’

title: DMK’s rule in T.N. an extension of Justice Party govt.: Chief Minister
content: Book released on the life and legacy of Justice Party leader and former Chief Minister of the erstwhile Madras Presidency P.T. Rajan titled Dravida Araneriyalar Thamizhavel P.T. Rajan Vaazhve Varalaru

title: HC stays single judge’s order against worship of Lord Buddha’s sculpture as Thalaivetti Muniappan by Hindus
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and K. Rajasekar grant the interim stay following a writ appeal filed by the Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments department

title: IB officer posted in Telangana among those killed in Pahalgam terror strike
content: The officer, identified as Manish Ranjan, a native of Bihar, was on vacation with his family in Kashmir at the time of the attack.

title: VMC team of corporators visits Bengaluru, studies development projects
content: BBMP Chief Commissioner welcomes and briefs them on the city’s development efforts, key challenges and administrative setup at the Integrated Command and Control Room

title: BJP takes dig at Congress ‘inability’ to choose Leader of Opposition in Haryana
content: Taking a dig at the Congress party, the BJP said that the Congress Party has lost its ability to make decisions

title: India aims to double share of manufacturing in GDP to 23% helped by sunrise sectors: FM
content: For India, she said, ‘scaling up manufacturing is essential to absorb a youthful workforce, reduce import dependencies and build competitive global supply chains’

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Blood flows on lush meadow as gunshots break afternoon calm
content: Amit Shah likely to visit Pahalgam; terrorists first asked for names before shooting down the victims, says a survivor; tourists ran for cover, but there was no place to hide; victims hail from States such as Karnataka, Maharashtra, Haryana, U.P.

title: Reschedule work hours to mitigate effect of extreme heatwaves, Centre tells States
content: Along with special attention for construction and brick kiln workers, the Labour Ministry has recommended adequate drinking water facilities, ventilation and cooling, rest areas, and health check-ups

title: How a previous attempt in Tamil Nadu to study Centre-State relations panned out
content: The DMK government, led by M.K. Stalin, has recently constituted a committee on the subject. Over 50 years ago, the report of the Rajamannar Committee, constituted by the M. Karunanidhi-led DMK government in September 1969, came out in May 1971 and ran into criticism from different parties, some of which are now allies of the DMK

title: Maharashtra government relents, Hindi no longer compulsory
content: School Education Minister Dadaji Bhuse explained that while Hindi will not be mandatory, students should study a third language from Class 1 as per their choice

title:
A modest menagerie to a sprawling refuge for wildlife — the story of 
Vandalur Zoo
content: In 1855, Edward Balfour, Director of the Government Central Museum in Madras, proposed a collection of live animals for public display on the museum premises. In 1861, the government relocated the animals to the People’s Park near Central Station. Limited space and pollution from the nearby industries forced the shift to Vandalur

title: EU’s far-right vs judiciary conflict
content: Certain far-right political figures in the European Union have been subjects of recent high-profile court cases that did not end in their favour, giving rise to accusations of political persecution and some deep contentions about judicial independence

title: Kiren Rijiju slams Mamata Banerjee for ‘refusing to implement’ Waqf Act
content: The  Union Minister of Parliamentary Affairs said the West Bengal CM’s ‘misguided remarks on the Waqf Act’ had ‘led to the violence in Murshidabad’

title: ED briefs Delhi court on U.K. court denying Sanjay Bhandari’s extradition to India
content: Bhandari, a defence consultant, wanted on charges of tax evasion and money laundering, has cited the “unsafe conditions” in the Tihar Jail in Delhi

title: A.P. Govt. committed to development of Children with Special Needs, says official
content: Autism centres planned in 125 municipalities in State to provide skill development, specialised training, announces Director of School Education V. Vijay Rama Raju

title: Bill on simultaneous polls unconstitutional: A.M. Singhvi
content: The Congress MP tells parliamentary committee that the Bill seeks to subordinate State election cycle to the parliamentary elections, which is a violation of the federal principle and thereby basic structure of Constitution

title: South Western Railway rolls out Indian Railways’ first Converged Communication System
content: The new AI-driven CCTV system uses machine learning algorithms to track live footage and detect specific events such as unusual motion, lighting changes, colour patterns (e.g., a person in a red shirt), and even potentially dangerous scenarios such as loitering or a person collapsing.

title: Kerala government tasks special team to ensure safety of Keralites in Jammu and Kashmir
content: Those requiring help or information should call the NoRKA helpline number 18004253939 or give a missed call to 00918802012345

title: Fruit vendor murder case solved, four arrested
content: Shaik Sadiq Valli’s murder solved as Kadapa police arrest four accused in Ramarajupalle over past rivalry

title: 77 apartment owners in Chander Kunj Army Towers opt for buy-back
content: The decision was conveyed at a meeting of the district committee, chaired by the Collector; a tentative schedule drawn up to shift residents by June 30 and complete the demolition within four months thereafter

title: SC sub-classification paves way for APPSC’s pending recruitments
content: Commission likely to release 18 notifications soon pertaining to 866 vacant posts in various government departments

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Narrow escape for three Kerala High Court judges
